techmeme.title: Amazon plans to invest $1.4B to build or maintain 14K affordable houses near its offices, on top of its prior $2.2B housing investment in 2021 in WA, VA, and TN (Haleluya Hadero/Associated Press)
German startup Black Semiconductor raised €254M, comprising €229M in public grants and €26M in equity, to build chips using graphene for mass production in 2031 (Arno Schuetze/Bloomberg)
SK Telecom says South Korean AI chip developers Rebellions and Sapeon Korea are pursuing a merger, in a bid to boost chip share in the next two to three years (Joyce Lee/Reuters)
Rubrik reports Q1 revenue up 38% YoY to $187.3M, above $171.5M est., and ARR up 46% YoY to $856.1M, in the cybersecurity company's inaugural post-IPO earnings (Charles Gorrivan/Bloomberg)
UAE Minister of AI and Digital Economy Omar Al Olama says fears over China using Middle Eastern countries to overcome US sanctions on AI chips are "valid" (Tobias Mann/The Register)
